basic.floral_language:
Clematis napaulensis 
Floriography: pure, beautiful, tolerant
Clematis napaulensis has oval or lanceolate leaves, stamens and pistils completely exposed when flowers in full bloom, with elegant colors such as white, purple, pink and so on, single-layer or multi-layer petals. Clematis napaulensis are generally used for landscaping as hanging or climbing plants to make hedges, walls, fences, arches and others.
Clematis napaulensis likes ample sunlight, shade properly in summer to avoid strong sunlight. Flowering period January-April for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period January-February, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
